loadout.name:  - Celestial Nighthawk - 
loadout.notes: since #solar 3.0, this exotic has been outclassed by calibans hand and ignition builds.

loadout.name: Ahamkara's Spine - 
loadout.notes: #solar, this build creates a constant flow of tripmines. gunpowder gamble requires ability kills, but the tripmine regen doesn't, it just needs ability damage (knives do damage and apply scorch, nade does damage, ignitions do damage, scorch does damage), which means you can loop it nearly infinitely.

loadout.name: Renewal Grasps - 
loadout.notes: A decent #stasis build for #endgame content. It would be good to build around the increased grenade cooldown, but high discipline is a good starting place.

loadout.name: Athrys's Embrace - 
loadout.notes: Could be an interesting combination to stun #barrier and #unstoppable champions in #pve, need to see how easy #solar ignitions are to create because Caliban's Hand might be more useful then

loadout.name: Frostees - 
loadout.notes: created as #stasis, but could be made #neutral if needed

loadout.name: Armamentarium - 
loadout.notes: #strand, #neutral

loadout.name: Stareaters - 
loadout.notes: technically #neutral, but these seem to get the most use in #void

loadout.name: Assassin's Cowl - 
loadout.notes: #arc really needs some way to generate health in #pve, and honestly even then the regen from the subclass alone feels terrible in mid-to-high end content. This allows for a small downtime between kills if needed, and gives ability uptime through wells and ionic traces.

loadout.name: Assassin's Cowl - 
loadout.notes: #stasis build to have health regen on shrunken kills. Struggles in high-end content where melees aren't killing, but finishers providing invis on #solar and #stasis isstill very nice. Could probably be translated to #solar pretty easily with some mod adjustments

loadout.name:  - Verity's Brow - 
loadout.notes: #stasis

loadout.name:  - Geomags - 
loadout.notes: #arc

loadout.name:  - Contraverse Holds - 
loadout.notes: #void, wells can be tested still

loadout.name: Verity's Brow - 
loadout.notes: The ultimate #void build. Collective obligation is almost always active because of the grenade loop, and with suppressing and weakening grenades, as well as volatile rounds on grenade kills, it's easy to pass all those debuffs on to multiple enemies. On top of that, font of might is almost always active giving a major damage buff.

loadout.name: Stag PvE - 
loadout.notes: #arc

loadout.name: Secant Filaments - 
loadout.notes: Secant filaments work on #neutral subclasses to make #overload rounds, but this loadout was made for a #void subclass. Getting devour to proc in #endgame content is somewhat difficult, so this gets the ball rolling, allowing grenades to be used for debuffs instead of kills.

loadout.name: Crest of Alpha Lupi PvE Arc - 
loadout.notes: This build could pretty easily be made #neutral, but the other subclasses have healing methods built into the subclass, so it isn't necessary on anything other than #arc

loadout.name: Doomfangs - 
loadout.notes: #void, elemental wells really make this build. Melee wellmaker works with any melee so long as you have an overshield, which you get from a barricade. Getting two wells from using any ability allows for really high ability uptime. I was getting 1.5 minute supers with constant ads, but the build is still viable because you can kick everything off with reaping wellmaker again.

loadout.name: Falling Star - 
loadout.notes: #arc

loadout.name: Falling Star (Energy Converter) - 
loadout.notes: #arc, grenade throws should get 15% of super back, capping at ~2 throws for 50% super back

loadout.name: Heart of Inmost Light Stasis - 
loadout.notes: #stasis, build contains elemental shards but doesn't really make use of them, so switching to bountiful wells, elemental ordinance, or some cwl mods would be smart.

loadout.name: Skullfort - 
loadout.notes: #arc, makes use of melee wells to get ability uptime

loadout.name: Ursas - 
loadout.notes: #void

loadout.name:  - Burning Steps PvE - 
loadout.notes: Could technically be #neutral, but would gain faster stacks when using a #solar subclass.

loadout.name:  - Phoenix Cradle - 
loadout.notes: #solar, mostly for #casual team based content, but double the length of sunspots is pretty good on its own

loadout.name:  - Dawn Chorus - 
loadout.notes: #solar, not worth using since 3.0 with classy restoration since messed up the damage increase in super, but it might have some use after classy restoration where health is more important. 300% scorch is a big incease.

loadout.name:  - Nezarec's Sin - 
loadout.notes: #void, the nerf to regen time really hurt this and since 300% super increase for 2 seconds is the only benefit over verity's brow, I might as well just use that

loadout.name: Shards of Galanor - 
loadout.notes: shards are probably better than celestial in #solar 3.0

loadout.name: PvP Bakris - 
loadout.notes: #stasis

loadout.name: Omnioculus - 
loadout.notes: #void, would be nice to have more mobility or recovery, but resilience is so good atm that it feels worth sacrificing almost any stat for it

loadout.name:  - Lunafactions - 
loadout.notes: Z #solar for the same reasoning as the lastwish loadout

loadout.name:  - Felwinter's Helm
loadout.notes: #neutral, good with long range melees that can kill enemies. Could be a #endgame build, so long as you can make use of it. Anything in lesser content can be easily killed without worrying about procing the perk.

loadout.name:  - BotA - 
loadout.notes: #solar, seems like a very good replacement for bubble

loadout.name: Starfire Protocol - 
loadout.notes: I've actually found that this #solar build is better on healing rift in #endgame content. Getting used to the cure from heat rises might be a viable alternative, but there needs to be a way to heal.

loadout.name: Stag PvE - 
loadout.notes: #stasis, Damage resistance is incredible in #endgame content.

loadout.name: Crown of Tempest - 
loadout.notes: #casual #arc

loadout.name: Rain of Fire - 
loadout.notes: #solar, This build's viability in #endgame content really depends on the seasonal mods. Without them, it's great for continuous damage buffs in #casual content.

loadout.name: A Current GM Weapon Set - 
loadout.notes: Guns that are good for #endgame and gms based on the current champion mods

loadout.name: Aeons Shatterdive - 
loadout.notes: #stasis build more focused around breaking crystals than stunning champs. mods could probably be updated

loadout.name: Gyrfalcon's Hauberk - 
loadout.notes: The loop between invisibility, volatile, and a damage boost is amazing with #void weapons and allows nightstalker to have a role in #endgame content outside of invisibility.

loadout.name: Aeons Duskfield - 
loadout.notes: #stasis, really only needed for strikes with overload to reset the stun constantly. super good with artifact mods that involve stunning champions

loadout.name: Graviton Forfeit - 
loadout.notes: #void build for solo invis requirements. should add utility kickstart and adjust to resilience meta before using

loadout.name: Felwinter's Helm
loadout.notes: This #neutral is good with melees that can kill in #endgame, but would probably be good with #void when using finishers.

loadout.name: Aeons - 
loadout.notes: #stasis, could easily be changed to #neutral with some mod changes. Mostly for #endgame content since ammo is important in gms.

loadout.name: Heart of Inmost Light Arc - 
loadout.notes: #arc the damage output of grenades in this build is insane, allowing a single storm grenade to do more damage than chaos reach (also you get that damage back every 15 seconds). could probably find a way to get some insane super regen out of this (maybe energy converter or ashes to assets) but the grenade regen is probaly more important anyway since crash isn't great without curias

loadout.name:  - Raid VotD - 
loadout.notes: #neutral, mods are set up as a cwl #stasis build, but could be pretty easily changed to a well build.

loadout.name: Heart of Inmost Light Void - 
loadout.notes: #void

loadout.name: Stag PvE - 
loadout.notes: #solar, Damage resistance is incredible in #endgame content.

loadout.name: Phoenix Protocol - 
loadout.notes: #solar, the mods for this are better set up than the recovery loadout. resilience is king atm

loadout.name: Aeons
loadout.notes: Created as #void, but could easily be made #neutral. Would probably work well with #stasis (use disc instead of res mods) or #solar.

loadout.name:  - Heart of Inmost Light Solar - 
loadout.notes: #solar, given how powerful restoration is, I'm not sure well of life is needed. Bountiful wells could provide some further ability uptime, but a weapon buff mod would round out the build.

loadout.name:  - Necrotic Grips - 
loadout.notes: #neutral

loadout.name: Stormdancers - 
loadout.notes: #arc

loadout.name: PvP Transversives
loadout.notes: Add taking charge to boots

loadout.name: Loreley Splendor - 
loadout.notes: #solar, the ability to get restoration (as well as the other benefits of sunspots) on command is insane and this will continue to be an incredible build without seasonal mods

loadout.name:  - Helm of Saint XIV - 
loadout.notes: #void

loadout.name: Stag PvE - 
loadout.notes: #void, Damage resistance is incredible in #endgame content.

loadout.name: PvP Citan's Ramparts
loadout.notes: #neutral
serves as a barrier between active and inactive loadouts

loadout.name:  - Promethium Spur - 
loadout.notes: #solar, not having control over rift location seems bad, but getting energy back in a rift is great. if regen is high enough it could be good?

loadout.name:  - Eye of Another World
loadout.notes: #neutral but mostly good with #stasis since it surpasses ability cooldown caps

loadout.name: PvP Dragon's Shadow
loadout.notes: #neutral

loadout.name: PvP Inmost Light
loadout.notes: #neutral

loadout.name:  - Orpheus Rigs - 
loadout.notes: #void

loadout.name: PvP Wormhusk
loadout.notes: #neutral

loadout.name: PvP Stompees
loadout.notes: #neutral

loadout.name: Stompees
loadout.notes: #stasis

loadout.name:  - Last Wish - 
loadout.notes: #neutral but since the only important exotic is lunas, might as well use well + #solar

annotation.notes: #pvp, original quest reward and first gun with demo
#neutral, #pve, this seems good with ranged melees as long as they can kill in #endgame
#arc, #casual #pve, test vintage timber w/ no orn
#solar, #endgame #pve, resilience is best stat atm, keep other in case something changes
#void, #casual #pve, if using void guns, it seems like verity's would be more effective since the timer nerf
#pve, high recovery + high discipline + high intellect, (replace iron remembrance)
#pvp, high recovery + high discipline, usually takes sister shader with ada armor, keep for iron banner bonus
#endgame #pve, #warmind, higher dps but lower total damage, BEST FOR #dps
#neutral #pvp, high recovery, might be good with fast firing weapons but it's basically hir
high recovery, make arc and replace id:6917529292583535551 AND replaced by id:6917529674978966501
#neutral #solar, #raid #pve, bota with emp rift might be a better option post bubble nerf
#endgame/#casual #pve, #warmind, if there's ever barrier mg this thing will slap
#pvp, high total, transmog with prestige leviathan helmet
#pvp, #endgame #pve, > #dps. aggressive will have better total damage IF it has tt+vorpal, CURRENT BEST FOR TOTAL DMG
#endgame #pve, #barrier/#overload for damage increase and reducing required shot count
#pvp, this gun has insane stats for a 120, and outlaw offsets the reload loss from iron grip
#pvp, might replace best in slot with snapshot change
#neutral, #pvp, #endgame #pve, interacts well with #stasis and surpasses ability cooldown caps
#endgame/#casual #pve, really good for burst #dps, but not great for champions
#neutral, #raid #pve, could be good replacement after bubble nerf, but people have to not be in the rift
#raid, high recovery + high intellect, keep for mod slot
#neutral, #pve, high recovery + high intellect, might be good for #stasis or #void. orpheus gives basically 50% buff
#solar, #casual #pve, viable in #endgame with classy restoration, but the build needs a way to heal without it.
#endgame #pve, #dps but switch to blinding for non-dps content
#endgame #pve, #barrier/#overload for damage increase and reducing required shot count
#endgame/#casual #pve, able to use explosive and damage buff for #overload rounds
#pvp, slide/opening shot w accurized maxes range at 7m. Handling has become increasingly important.
#pvp, killing wind gives a decent range and handling boost, but requires a kill to get there.
#pvp, if backup plan is good - qd is good pair
#casual #pve, really good for #overload since it resets stun timer
#solar, #casual #pve, high intellect, lots of additional scorch, but starfire is just so good. Have to come back to it
#endgame/#casual #pve, #dps, explosive light helpful for procing orb mods
high recovery, keep for mod slot
#pve, high recovery + high discipline, replace iron fellowship robes since this doesnt have an artifact slot now
#casual #pve, might be good in #endgame or for #dps since slideshot can reload quickly
#endgame #pve, lasting impressions is really good #dps for everything except champs
#endgame/#casual #pve, might be better than demo depending on how easy it is to proc ofa
#pvp, tunnel vision and kc pair well, but 3s is a long reload, QAS helps with slow handling. steady hand out stats this
#endgame #pve, #overload, basically nation of beasts. Have to test for the feel of each, but rh probably wins
#endgame #pve, this thing is insane for burst damage
#pvp, wastelander's range caps out at 7m, so a range mw doesn't actually do anything while both perks are active
#solar, #pvp, #endgame/#casual #pve. double restoration / restoration on demand is insane
#endgame #pve, adaptive is good for #barrier, try to level one to 13
#endgame/#casual #pve, probably not bad for #unstoppable since you can reset the stun cooldown and detonate enemies
#casual #pve, could be #endgame if I need a void smg
#endgame #pve, keep for adaptive munitions until the craftable one is leveled. keep for adept big ones
high recovery, keep until better artifice armor
high total, id:6917529760062212524 is better but I'm not sure it makes enought of a difference
#endgame #pve, adaptive buff works on #barrier shields too
#endgame #pve, demo in the first column is rare and getting a damage perk in the second column could allow this to shine
#endgame/#casual #pve, overflow (E) allows for ~90 in the mag, allowing much easier activations of ff
#neutral #void, #pve, seems viable for #endgame solo content with overload or a build that heals teammates
#endgame #pve, afa is incredible. can also roll with adaptive and rapid hit as alternative for matchgame. needs reload
#solar, #casual #pve, #pvp, these are slightly better than the other pair, but neither are fantastic, #mw
high resilience + high intellect, if intellect becomes useful the stat total is insane
#casual #pve, only #endgame in activities that have high enemy density since the healing + trait both help survivability
high resilience + high discipline, id:6917529804444665193 is better, but this has an artifice slot
#endgame #pve, great for gms and champions bc of alh, but needs a way to get orbs without dying
this could be amazing in #pvp with revives, but there are better #pve exotics since you dont normally need an overshield
#pve, while this doesnt have a damage perk, it has cc and fp, which allow for higher #dps at the cost of total damage
#endgame #pve, good for raids bc of uptime on orbs, but for #dps in smaller groups, it falls off
#pvp, rangefinder is keeping this around, bringing the range just over 18m
#pve, #endgame: alh since cc should activate on every round. #casual: unrelenting on crystal detonation
#pvp, not sure how good desperado is on a 390, but it would be worth checking out
high recovery + high discipline, replace id:6917529200982161158
#endgame #pve, explosive payload is good for #barrier/#overload to reduce shot count required
#raid, high recovery + high discipline, replace iron fellowship robes
#casual #pve, I think joltshot does enough to be #endgame even without an #arc subclass
#endgame #pve, good for #barrier and #unstoppable since you can burn through shields and get a free damage buff
could be #endgame #pve at level 10, but I'm not sure I like how the gun even feels
#endgame #pve, the only hand cannon I know if with adaptive, not sure how good it would be though
high recovery + high discipline. #pvp, replace id:6917529202874956490
#casual #pve, wouldn't normally keep, but this has great origin traits and it's stasis
#casual #pve, cascade point gives this 230rpm for 2.5 (^ 2.75) seconds, could be a #dps contender if shotguns are buffed
#casual #endgame #pve, I don't know if an smg has a large enough mag for afa, but it would be worth testing
#casual #pve, might be a replacement for sacred providence
#pvp, need to see if desperado feels good on this pulse
#solar #pve, not sure if this is good or not, but it at one point had good community reviews
#casual #pve, I think reservoir burst works with runneth over, so this would allow multiple burst shows in a row
#casual #pve, S19 glaive is significantly better, but this has a faster rpm so maybe having both would be good, level 13
#casual #pve, this thing is an ability regenning machine
